a.title: Search for Children with Disabilities Underway

div.a: Search for Children with Disabilities Underway

nav.div: Bellefontaine City Schools » District » Notices » District Statistics & Disclosures » BCS Disclosures

div.strong:
TITLE IX V SECTION 504 COORDINATOR/
SEXUAL HARASSMENT GRIEVANCE OFFICER
div.br:
The Bellefontaine City School District is dedicated to providing Equal opportunities and
equal employment without regard to sex race color national origin age or disability. For
more information contact Brad Hall Superintendent 937-593-9706.
IDEA-B FLOW-THRU PUBLIC NOTICE
The Bellefontaine City School District is allocated IDEA-B federal Monies to
provide programs and services for children with a disability. For more
information contact Christine Galvin Assistant Superintendent 937-593-9060.
ADVISORY TO PARENTS OF PESTICIDE APPLICATION
As parents/guardians you have the right to be informed prior to any
application of a pesticide made to school property during the school year.
In certain emergencies pesticides may be applied without prior notice to
prevent injury to students and staff but you will be notified following
any such application. If you would like to be notified please contact
Brad Hall Superintendent at 593-9060.
AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
The Bellefontaine City School District provides equal opportunities for
employment retention and advancement of all people regardless of
race color creed natural origin political affiliation age sex handicapping
condition or military status. (BOE Policy 7001)
EQUAL EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES
The Bellefontaine Board of Education will provide each eligible schoolage
child in the Bellefontaine City School District the opportunity to
obtain a quality education. This opportunity will be provided without
regard to the childís ethnic or racial background religious beliefs sex or
economic social or handicapping conditions
